item.title: The Chaos Butterfly of Security Standards
item.description: The mathematician and meteorologist, Edward Lorenz, made the Butterfly Effect famous with his talk in 1972, “Does the Flap of a Butterfly’s Wings in Brazil Set Off a Tornado in Texas?” and it’s stuck in the popular conscious ever since. The notion that small events in a chaotic system can build to large changes over time and space. In large companies I frequently see a hope that a similar mechanism will occur when a security standard is published to the company SharePoint.
